channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report E-2023100703
item.description:
Report E-2023100703

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: SCOTT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES L
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 10, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon pails and five (5) one-gallon pails of paint (UN1263) were crushed during transit and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3OMI to remediate the impacted site. The crew deployed absorbents to the release and utilized hand tools to collect all debris in four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report I-2023100006
item.description:
Report I-2023100006

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: DARROW
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARTIN TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at the customer in Bumside, LA. When he stopped at the guard shack to check in, he noticed product coming from his crash box on top of the trailer. Driver climbed on top of the trailer to see where the product was coming from. Upon inspection, driver could see that the grommet where the air/nitrogen line hooks up had a crack in it. At this time it appeared this was what had caused the leak. Mechanic was called out to make repairs by replacing the grommet. Once mechanic got on scene, he discovered that the valve had been left open causing the product to come out of the line. Mechanic replaced the cracked grommet and closed the valve. Environmental company was called out to clean the product off the ground and to clean the trailer. Driver was able to off load without any further issues.
